Package org.blockchainnative.fabric

Class FabricContractWrapperGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.blockchainnative.fabric.FabricContractWrapperGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContractWrapperGenerator
    public class FabricContractWrapperGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContractWrapperGenerator
    Generates wrapper classes for Hyperledger Fabric chaincodes.

    Supported Types

    All parameters are passed/retrieved as UTF-8 encoded Strings to/from the chaincode.
    Java Strings are automatically converted by the wrapper classes, for every other type instance of TypeConverter is required.
    However, FabricDefaultTypeConverters.getConverters() provides type converters for the following types:

    • boolean
    • byte
    • short
    • int
    • long
    • float
    • double

    Special Arguments

    All contract methods can handle the following special arguments.

    Target Peers

    Specifies the peers targeted by a method.
    A parameter declared as such needs to be an Collection of String containing the peer names as defined in the network configuration.
    Target peers can be defined via FabricContractInfo.setTargetPeerNames(Set) or via a special argument (Constants.TARGET_PEERS_ARGUMENT). If no target peers are set, every method will target all peers known to the channel.

    User

    Specifies the user context to be used by a method.
    A parameter declared as such needs to be an User.

    Special Methods

    Install

    A method marked as special method and named 'install' (Constants.INSTALL_METHOD) installs the Hyperledger Fabric chaincode on the target peers.
    In order to be able to install the chaincode on the target peers and a user (Constants.USER_ARGUMENT) with the correct permissions is required. Moreover, the following properties of the corresponding contract info need to be set: FabricContractInfo.chaincodeSourceDirectory and FabricContractInfo.chaincodeLanguage.
    The return type of an install method needs to be void.

    Instantiate

    A method marked as special method and named 'instantiate' (Constants.INSTANTIATE_METHOD) instantiates the Hyperledger Fabric chaincode on the target peers and submits a transaction to the orderer.
    In order to be able to instantiate the chaincode on the target peers and a user (Constants.USER_ARGUMENT) with the correct permissions is required. Moreover, the following properties of the corresponding contract info need to be set: FabricContractInfo.chaincodeSourceDirectory, FabricContractInfo.chaincodePolicy and FabricContractInfo.chaincodeLanguage.
    All parameters not marked as special arguments are converted and passed to the constructor.
    The return type of an instantiate method needs to be void.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • FabricContractWrapperGenerator

        public FabricContractWrapperGenerator​(java.util.function.Supplier<org.hyperledger.fabric.sdk.HFClient> clientFactory,
                                      java.util.function.Function<org.hyperledger.fabric.sdk.HFClient,org.hyperledger.fabric.sdk.Channel> channelFactory,
                                      TypeConverters typeConverters)
        Initializes a new FabricContractWrapperGenerator.

        For each contract wrapper, a new instances of HFClient and Channel are retrieved via its factories.
        It is possible for those factories to always return the same instance.

        Parameters:
        clientFactory - factory producing HFClient instances for communicating with the Hyperledger Fabric network.
        channelFactory - factory producing Channel instances for authorizing transactions. An instance of HFClient produced via clientFactory is passed to this function.
        typeConverters - additional TypeConverter, may be null

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public <TContractInfo extends ContractInfo<TContractType,?,?>,TContractType> TContractType generate​(TContractInfo contractInfo)
        Generates a new wrapper for the smart contract described by contractInfo.
        Although defined otherwise by the interface, contractInfo needs to be of type FabricContractInfo.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface ContractWrapperGenerator
        Type Parameters:
        TContractInfo - type of the contract info, required to be FabricContractInfo
        TContractType - Java interface declaring the chaincode methods and events
        Parameters:
        contractInfo - contract info representing the chaincode
        Returns:
        implementation of the given smart contract interface TContractType
